docs.snippet: Rule-breaking at an early age may point to the success of company founders like Martin Shkreli, researchers say. It may also foretell their undoing.

headline.print_headline: Young Rebels Who Rise, Then Fall
headline.main: The Shkreli Syndrome: Youthful Trouble, Tech Success, Then a Fall

docs.snippet: The company announced its most expensive iPhone, priced at $999, at an event on Tuesday. Read our analysis of what Apple unveiled.

headline.print_headline: Apple Unveils iPhone X and 8 Models as It Upgrades TV Set-Top Box
headline.main: Apple Unveils iPhone X and 8 Models as It Upgrades TV Set-Top Box

docs.snippet: The State of New Jersey took over running the district because of low performance, but real educational progress has been slow in coming.

headline.print_headline: Stabler Newark Set to Take Back Reins of Schools
headline.main: After More Than 20 Years, Newark to Regain Control of Its Schools

docs.snippet: Food and water were in short supply on many islands in the Caribbean after Hurricane Irma, and witnesses spoke of a disintegration of law and order.

headline.print_headline: A Devastated Island’s Cry: ‘All the Food Is Gone’
headline.main: Desperation Mounts in Caribbean Islands: ‘All the Food Is Gone’

docs.snippet: Decades after the company tried to tackle sexual misconduct at two Chicago plants, continued abuse raises questions about the possibility of change.

headline.main: How Tough Is It to Change a Culture of Harassment? Ask Women at Ford

docs.snippet: Nathan Myhrvold and Francisco Migoya’s myth-busting new book, “Modernist Bread,” is a call for bakers to experiment and innovate.

headline.main: Using Science and History to Unlock the Secrets of Bread

docs.snippet: Florida opened dozens more shelters as the first wind and rainbands reached the state Saturday; more than 100,000 people were already without power.

headline.print_headline: Hurricane 300 Miles Wide  Trains Its Fury on Florida
headline.main: Irma’s Fearsome Winds Reach Florida Shores, With Full Strike Yet to Come

docs.snippet: An on-the-ground investigation reveals that the U.S.-led battle against ISIS — hailed as the most precise air campaign in history — is killing far more Iraqi civilians than the coalition has acknowledged.
Suny Santana, brought to America as a child, was set to open a restaurant when he learned that the government may end his permission to stay.

headline.main: His Dream in Reach, an Immigrant Chef Is Suddenly Unsettled

docs.snippet: Police in Houston say more than 20 people remain unaccounted for, and efforts to find them have been complicated by post-storm chaos.

headline.print_headline: After the Storm, a Grim Hunt in Texas for Those Who Are Still Missing
headline.main: After Harvey, a Grim Hunt in Texas for Those Still Missing
